structure.unit: TITLE TO PROPERTY AND RESTRICTIONS ON USE, OWNERSHIP, AND ALIENATION

law.text: When the owner or lessee of a salt, or other well or spring, or stream or body of water, desires to convey the water therefrom to a point more convenient by means of pipes underground, he may, if necessary, condemn the use of so much land of another as is needed for the purpose. The procedure for condemnation shall be that set forth in the Eminent Domain Act of Kentucky.
law.history: Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 140, sec. 118. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4360.
